fields.description:
There is issue is affecting our ability to use private listing licenses.  We have a private listing "GJC Staging / Test", that we using to as a stage to test our add-on.  After adding a license, we are experiencing licensing errors, even though the license is valid.  Checking the url used to access our add-on lic=none, though UPM says it's valid.  I have attached screenshots of the request url (lic=none), license (showing it's value), and error.

Please help ASAP, as we have a bug we need to deploy, but cannot verify on our staging environment before pushing to production.

Edit: The private listing for our Confluence add-on is working normally.  We requested that private listing "GCC Staging / Test" be removed about a month ago.  Is it possible that "GjC Staging / Test" was removed by mistake?   Both listings are still present, however..
fields.summary: cannot use license tokens for private listing

fields.description:
Dear Atlassian-team.

the article indicates that you should use content.id rather than page.id. However Confluence cloud as of today does not correctly set the content.id ( the deprecated page.id is set correctly).

Kind regards,

Andreas

*Reporter*: Andreas Purde
*E-mail*: [mailto:andreas@purde.de]
fields.summary: content.id not submitted

fields.description:
In my particular case I need to use {{has_page_permission}} inside a a byline-dialog and inside the view of a dynamic-content-macro. So I've attached an inline-condition to the iframe url which looks like this: &hasPageWritePermissions={condition.has_page_permission(permission=EDIT)}

In case of the byline-dialog it works as expected, hasPageWritePermissions is set to 'true'.
However, in case of the dynamic-content-macro, hasPageWritePermissions is set to 'false'.

Are these conditions supposed to work inside of dynamic-content-macros? If not, I think the value should be set to an empty string instead of 'false' to avoid confusion.
fields.summary: has_page_permission inline condition always returns false

fields.description:

# Install an add-on
# Release a new version of the add-on
# Wait for the add-on to be automatically upgraded

*Actual Results*

The upgrade fails due to being run without a current user.

{code}

fields.description:
Original issue: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFDEV-55895

Even though the fuzzy search is mentioned in this docs but it doesn't work atm. https://developer.atlassian.com/confdev/confluence-server-rest-api/advanced-searching-using-cql/performing-text-searches-using-cql
Content Search CQL and expansions
The CQL is: 
type="ac:com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-questions:question" AND title~"foam~" order by created desc, title
 
https://atl-vertigo-cq-eduardo.jira-dev.com/wiki/rest/api/content/search?expand=space%2Cmetadata.labels%2Chistory.createdBy%2Cchildren.ac__com_atlassian_confluence_plugins_confluence_questions__answer%2Cchildren.ac__com_atlassian_confluence_plugins_confluence_questions__answer.history.createdBy%2Cchildren.comment%2Cchildren.comment.history.createdBy%2Cmetadata.properties.atl_cq_votes%2Cchildren.ac__com_atlassian_confluence_plugins_confluence_questions__answer.metadata.properties.atl_cq_votes%2Cmetadata.properties.atl_cq_accepted_answer%2Cchildren.ac__com_atlassian_confluence_plugins_confluence_questions__answer.metadata.properties.atl_cq_accepted_answer&cql=type%3D%22ac%3Acom.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-questions%3Aquestion%22+AND+title~%22foam~%22+order+by+created+desc%2C+title&start=0&limit=15

fields.description:
More edge cases around the hash generation has cause a few more cases of macros unable to collect their body.

A spike was done to find a better way to calculate and track the macro hash (CE-54), this issue represents applying this new hash generation to make the macro body collection more robust.

fields.description:
So there's an endpoint {{/rest/prototype/1/user/current}} for getting information on the currently logged in user.

Apparently it actually redirects to an actual user's URL, e.g. {{/rest/prototype/1/user/non-system/admin}}

This seems to break query string hash validation when the endpoint is hit from the add-on server (with JWT auth).

Example query:

- URL: https://mydevserver:8443/confluence/rest/prototype/latest/user/current
- Canonical Request: {{GET&/rest/prototype/latest/user/current&}}
- query string hash: 2704ad05afcd6b7c6670ac87b9581c265c12fd4a3e9742215f8a0cc84738d336

Confluence server responds with 401 Unauthorized and complains about QSH:
{code}
Expecting claim 'qsh' to have value '526e7c7ce5483b86db6807ac8bd37159de84794487aea9940dea7cc017f9ceec' but instead it has the value '2704ad05afcd6b7c6670ac87b9581c265c12fd4a3e9742215f8a0cc84738d336'
{code}

A couple of facts:
* I verified my signed REST call with https://jwt-decoder.herokuapp.com/jwt/decode
* I am able to successfully hit other endpoints with the same code (e.g. {{/rest/api/content/{id}/child/attachment}}) so Confluence must be calculating QSH of some other URL here, I wasn't able to reverse-engineer it
fields.summary: Fix REST endpoint for getting the currently logged in user

fields.description:
The page.* and blog.* context parameters are deprecated and should be replaced with content.* parameters.  Currently the content.* parameters are not being substituted.

# create an addon, with a macro
# on the url parameter, use {{contentId=\{content.id\}}}
# note that the contentId query parameter will not be set
fields.summary: content.* context parameters don't work for macros

fields.description:
The order of child pages show in the API does not match the order show in the Confluence UI.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Create a page, and under it, create a series of child pages with names starting with different characters. You will see that in the Confluence UI they are ordered alphabetically.
Next, load the child pages API for that parent page. If the parent page you created has the ID 5308424, then the URL would be /rest/api/content/5308424/child?expand=page.title

h3.  Expected Behaviour
The order of pages matches the UI

h3. Behaviour Experienced
You will see that the order of the pages does not match the UI and that the "extensions" -> "position" property is "none".
fields.summary: The order of child pages show in the API does not match the order show in the Confluence UI.

fields.description:
When attempting to download the default space logo using a JWT authentication header a HTTP 403 is returned: Example URL: https://jens-k15t.atlassian.net/wiki/images/logo/default-space-logo-256.png Response: {code:title=HTTP 403 Forbidden} Apache Tomcat/7.0.68 - Error report

HTTP Status 403 - Request not in an authorized API scope

type Status report

message Request not in an authorized API scope

description Access to the specified resource has been forbidden.

Apache Tomcat/7.0.68

{code} This probably also affects other images located at '/images/...'.
fields.summary: Default space logo download URLs are not in an authorized API scope

fields.description:
If two add-ons contribute 'spacetoolstabs' into the 'Add-ons' section, the installation of the second add-on breaks the first add-on's page:
* When navigating to the 'Add-ons' section, the link points to the first add-on but results in a 404 error page.
* When manually changing the links to the second add-on's page, the page loads, but the tab item of the first add-on is selected.

Furthermore the links to these spacetoolstabs pages do not contain the module key at all, in contrast to the documentation, see 'key' parameter description here: https://developer.atlassian.com/static/connect/docs/latest/modules/confluence/space-tools-tab.html

The links look as follows:
{{https://jens-k15t.atlassian.net/wiki/plugins/atlassian-connect/com.example.addon-a/.action?key=TEST}}
{{https://jens-k15t.atlassian.net/wiki/plugins/atlassian-connect/com.example.addon-b/.action?key=TEST}}

Find the example add-on's here:
https://github.com/jensrutschmann/connect-tests/tree/gh-pages/space-tools

They can be installed using the respective github.io links:
https://jensrutschmann.github.io/connect-tests/space-tools/a/atlassian-connect.json
https://jensrutschmann.github.io/connect-tests/space-tools/b/atlassian-connect.json

To reproduce this issue just install both add-ons, then use the 'Space Tools' button in the main navigation sidebar when viewing any Confluence page to jump to the 'Add-ons' section, or go to the Space Tools Overview page first and then go to the 'Add-ons' section.
fields.summary: Space tools 'Add-ons' section breaks when two add-ons provide 'spaceToolsTabs' modules

fields.description:
Trying to setup a custom register where I want to show the modified-date (using Page Information Macro (PIM))  from the individual pages in the Page Properties Report Macro (PPRM). It would seem that the PPRM evaluates the specific PIM according to its own set of metadata rather than the data for the item itself.

I've verified this behaviour in the standard Decision Register as well - where I added the PIM-versions to make it explicit what was going on.

Expected behaviour would be that the PPRM used the PIM-values being displayed on the individual page, NOT collectively
fields.summary: Page Properties Report Macro uses Page Information Macro data from @self page instead of from siblings
Error when loading Space Tools Tab with inline condition

fields.description:
In the Confluence Server REST API docs - it looks like all of the URL references in the doc under the section *Resources* have a path of /rest/... and should be /rest/api/...

https://docs.atlassian.com/atlassian-confluence/REST/latest-server/

Example:

/rest/audit
/rest/content
...etc.

and it looks like they should be:

/rest/api/audit
/rest/api/content
...etc.

Thanks for checking! :)

Dave
fields.summary: Confluence Server API docs - API URLs should be updated from "/rest" to "/rest/api"

fields.description:
Hi,

we are using the cofluence SOAP API for synchronizing content between different confluence instances. On production we use 5.4.1. We are now testing 5.7.1 and experience problems with 5.7.1: The method

getDescendents(String token, String pageId)

from the SOAP API (see https://developer.atlassian.com/confdev/confluence-rest-api/confluence-xml-rpc-and-soap-apis/remote-confluence-methods) used to return the page descendants. Now it returns an empty list.

I noticed that on the Java API there are now two similar methods (with a different typing) on the Page Object:

    getDescendents() [Deprecated]
    getDescendants()

see https://docs.atlassian.com/confluence/latest/com/atlassian/confluence/pages/Page.html

Could it be that this rename caused the problems in the SOAP API?

Best regards

Bernd

PS: the issue was originally raised as a support request - see 

https://support.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/14/CSP-143499
fields.summary: SOAP API: method getDescendents(String token, String pageId) does not work any more with Confluence 5.7.1

fields.description:
The page hierarchy copy code is currently using the old ContentPropertyManager for transferProperties.  This means if the the page has properties were created via rest ContentPropertyResource, they won't be visible to that code hence would not be copied.  As they were saved as db contentProperties.

It needs to be refactored into the new Json content properties which is currently exposed via REST.

Extension point is marked as TODO in code.
fields.summary: Support content properties when copying page tree

fields.description: General pages configured to use the default system.browse location in the Confluence UI are no longer appearing in Confluence OnDemand. The underlying add-on continues to work and the link appears in the OnDemand SDK.
fields.summary: system.browse location not available in Confluence

It starts failing here https://confluence-cloud-bamboo.internal.atlassian.com/browse/CONFFUNC-PLUGINS-CREATECONTENT03-1222/test
This one confuses me as I can't reproduce it locally. This is a unit test, but there might be side effects from build environment that I can't figured out yet.
[~rsu] mentioned this PR https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/CONFCLOUD/repos/confluence-create-content-plugin/pull-requests/6/overview, but I don't see how it is related.
fields.summary: Fix failed unit test TestDefaultBlueprintWebItemService#testCanSpecifyDirectLink

fields.description:
The pagination does not work correctly when listing child pages via the REST API.

I have a page with 300 children. I request the first two 100-element-sized subsets of children like so:
{code}
GET /wiki/rest/api/content/12345678/child/page?start=0&limit=100
GET /wiki/rest/api/content/12345678/child/page?start=100&limit=100
{code}
I would expect the two sets to be disjoint, but the first ten elements in the second set are the same as the last ten elements in the first.

The _start_, _limit_, and _size_ fields in the responses are as requested, that is they are {code}{… start: 0, limit: 100, size: 100 …}{code} and {code}{… start: 100, limit: 100, size: 100 …},{code} respectively.

I tried to reproduce the behavior on two different server instances (5.10.5 and 6.0.3), but I couldn't. I can only reproduce it on my On-Demand developer instance.

I can reproduce the issue with values for _limit_ as low as 6, but only in this particular space. Might there be something wrong with it that needs fixing?
fields.summary: Overlapping result pages when listing children via REST API

fields.description:
(connect add on)

* Add a web item to the user popup.
* Set the target to dialog
* Click on the web item

Actual: The dialog is not opened and the page redirected to the wrong url.
Expected: Should open the dialog.

It looks like the javascript is being bound to the user popup which is loaded lazily when the user popup is loaded.
fields.summary: Web Items in user popup don't open dialog

fields.description:
h1. Summary
CQLMacroBrowserTest testAllTypesDisplayed is flakey in the Tier 1 Plugins build, UI Components job.
The teardown method in the test also flakes regularly.

Several instances of this recorded in the past few days:

* https://confluence-cloud-bamboo.internal.atlassian.com/browse/CONFFUNC-PLUGINS4196-1
* https://confluence-cloud-bamboo.internal.atlassian.com/browse/CONFFUNC-PLUGINS4137-1
* https://confluence-cloud-bamboo.internal.atlassian.com/browse/CONFFUNC-PLUGINS4121-UICOMP-1

h1. Analysis
The pipelines team has a build which runs all tests in a a branch of confluence-ui-components against confluence green_master. This can be used to get feedback on flakyness, and if a fix has been successful. That build needs to be branched manually, and is configured to be run up to 4 concurrent builds, giving a total of 40 build + test runs for the plugin.

https://confluence-cloud-bamboo.internal.atlassian.com/browse/CDE-UICOMPSHAKE

CQLMacroBrowserTest#testAllTypesDisplayed has been ignored in https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/CONFCLOUD/repos/confluence-ui-components/pull-requests/10/diff as its not adding much value in its current state, however we still see the occasional flake during the teardown of other tests in that class.

From: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-46480
fields.summary: CQLMacroBrowserTest is flakey causing build to fail regularly
A macro with an icon and a custom editor opens with the default macro editor

fields.description:
Connect blueprint templates are specified as a URL, the results of the GET on this URL is cached perpetually in the create content module descriptor, this prevents blueprints from providing dynamic content.  

The ContentTemplateModuleDescriptor in the create content plugin should be updated to use a http client that respects http caching headers, but attempts to resolve the URL on each use of the template.
fields.summary: Dynamic blueprint templates for confluence connect
Content properties missing in search index after reindex of Confluence

fields.summary: bamboo log exception: Failed to send analytic events to MPAC
navigator.getLocation return unknow context on saved page

fields.description: There is no way to get an attachment content when the attachment is on a draft page.  We need to be able to do this to display a placeholder image in our add-on.  Using /rest/api/content/<att id> results in an error as well as /rest/api/content/<page id>child/attachment.  There are no options to specify the page is a draft like the request to create content.  We are working around this by calling the download url directly without getting it from the content object, but I am concerned the download url could change in the future without warning.  Please fix this so we can follow the proper workflow of getting the download url from the content.
fields.summary: Cannot GET attachment by REST API when attachment on a draft page

fields.description:
This was caught by the Connect team when preparing the release of Connect 1.2.0. 

The conditions required for this error to occur are: A Confluence instance, with at least one Connect addon installed, and none that provide an Autoconvert definition.

Confluence didn't catch it because it doesn't test with Connect addons, and the autoconvert tests didn't catch it because they have an addon with at least one autoconvert definition.
fields.summary: Null in autoconvert javascript prevents the Confluence editor from loading
Add-on breaks if it has a alias that is identical to the key

fields.description:
This is a minor one we found during our internal QA. When navigating backwards in the browser it seems that the entire page is cached since the old background image is still showing. Not sure if this is something that's fixable due to some browsers acting a bit weird when navigating back, I've only tested this in Chrome.

Steps to reproduce:

1. Set a background image for a space through the color scheme
2. Navigate to some content in a space
3. Change the space's background image through the color scheme (In another tab)
4. Navigate to a different piece of content
5. Go back

The background image will now be the old one. A reload solves this.
fields.summary: Navigating back in the browser shows incorrect background image
Cannot get JSON response from /rest/prototype/1/user/current
Calling the PageManager.move() methods in Confluence 6.0.1 results in tons warnings in the log (one per page to move)

fields.description:
We're using the /contentbody/convert/export_view service for rendering confluence content into static HMTL and expand the CSS webresource URIs to retrieve the corresponding styling.

The styles used by the inline tasks / task lists however seem to be in a different batch that is not included in the list of web resources when using the conversion service.

Steps to reproduce:
# Create a page containing inline tasks
# Inspect the CSS used by the task list items 
#* -> check out the batch URL
# Use the /contentbody/convert/export_view service and expand the CSS URIs
#* -> the batch including the styles is not included
fields.summary: Task list CSS styles are not included in batches referenced when converting content using the REST API
Weight properties of Web Items not working when location is system.space.sidebar/main-links

fields.description: Reported on the [Google Group|https://groups.google.com/d/msg/atlassian-connect-dev/nhKdaYvksr0/H_KkFHDAAQAJ].
fields.summary: Web panels at atl.general cause space sidebar to overlap top navigation bar
Concurrency problem with space REST API - LazyInitializationException

fields.description: Exporting to PDF in our Connect macro results in a SocketTimeoutException in the generated PDF (see attachment.)  We have created a renderMode endpoint as described in https://developer.atlassian.com/static/connect/docs/latest/modules/fragment/macro-render-modes.html.  The endpoint is simply trying to get the macro body in storage format and return that to the rendering process, no extra processing is being done by the add-on at this point.
fields.summary: SocketTimeoutException when exporting PDF in Connect Macro

fields.description:
We are developing an add-on that shows a footer when the user is editing a page.

It adds a web-panel with location "atl.footer"

In the new style Confluence (tested in version Confluence 1000.1668.0) there are two major problems when showing the footer in the editor mode:

# The custom footer is not initially visible
  * at the bottom of the editor is the default editor footer with "Publish", "Close" etc
  * the custom footer is under that footer and the user can see the footer added by the add-on only after scrolling to the bottom of the page

# The custom footer is sometimes added twice
  * sometimes the custom footer is added two times at the bottom of the page

These are major blocking issues for the add-on.

The add-on works as expected with the old style Confluence Cloud (eg. version 1000.0.0-e4e5af8)
fields.summary: Add-on using 'atl.footer' broken in new style Confluence Cloud

fields.description:
Disable the render modes that are not completely implemented.

Confluence is not setting the render mode (in the context) correctly for many of the render modes.  We should disable them before CE-67 goes out to avoid confusion.  Depending on the demand of these render modes we will revisit them in the future.
fields.summary: Disable incomplete render modes
Example HTTP outgoing post using Proxy

fields.description: Add the attribute data-linked-resource-id, data-linked-resource-type and where appropriate data-linked-resource-version to the a tags produced by the various ViewXLinkMarshallers when rendering links to confluence entities
fields.summary: Include content id on when rendering internal links for view

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Code block macro v. 2.2.4 is not working if the "collapsible" option is enabled.

h3. Environment
* Tested only in Confluence 5.8.18
* Code macro 2.2.4

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Start Confluence 5.8.18 
# Manually download the [Code Macro 2.2.4|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.confluence.ext.newcode-macro-plugin/versions].
# Manually upload the add-on.
# The add-on will be updated.
# If the "collapsible" option is "checked"(enabled), the macro won't work. The "expand source" link won't appear.

h3. Expected Results

The macro will expand/collapse properly.

h3. Actual Results

The "expand source" link is not appearing and you can't expand the content.
 
h3. Notes

Only tested at the moment in Conf 5.8.18

h3.Workaround
# Downgrade manually the add-on.
or
# Delete the plugin from the plugindata table to return to the bundled version(2.1.7).
{code}
delete from plugindata where pluginkey = 'com.atlassian.confluence.ext.newcode-macro-plugin'
{code}
fields.summary: Code block Macro 2.2.4 is not working(expanding) in Confluence 5.8.18
Space Tools Tab permission denied for non-space admin

fields.description:
Needs more investigation 

{quote} @mate the problem was that Balsamiq's P2 and Connect plugins expose the same macro to customers, so when they're both installed, there were failures of some sort (I don't know exactly what - we'd need to reach out to them for further information). Perhaps one thing we could do is ensure in Cloud that all pluggable points first check for Connect-provided functionality before checking for P2 equivalents. I'm thinking that perhaps Confluence has an inconsistent ordering where sometimes the Connect plugin has priority and other times P2 (but that's just a personal hunch). In UPM for example, AC is always checked for plugin state prior to checking the P2 plugins framework.{quote}
fields.summary: Connect silently failing on registration of a macro with the same key

fields.description:
These are new issues discovered after converting our static macros to dynamic ones (see DEVHELP-419). It could be an implementation error on my end but it doesn't seem as likely looking at the errors.

*Instance:* https://goodsoftwarestaging.atlassian.net/wiki/x/jaIK
(feel free to poke around in the instance)

h3. Context
Create a Confluence Cloud Connect add-on with a dynamic macro that takes a rich-text body and simply renders it back by:

# On the add-on server side request the macro body from Confluence
# Convert the macro body from "storage" format to "view" using the Confluence Cloud REST API "contentbody/convert/view"
# Render the result back in a layout that includes the assets returned in "webresource.superbatch" and "webresource.tags".

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a page containing the dynamic macro with a "Page properties report" macro and "JIRA" macro nested inside it.
# View the page. Observe both nested macros fail to load

h3. Why does the Page properties report fail to load?
After reading the minified javascript, it appears it internally calls AJS.contextPath() + path (where path is "/rest/masterdetail/1.0/detailssummary/lines"), but then uses AP.request to make the call which internally appends contextPath a second time, resulting in "https://instance.atlassian.net*/wiki/wiki/*rest/masterdetail...".

h3. Why does the JIRA macro fail to load?
Not sure, but it looks to be related to CORS.
fields.summary: Confluence macros that rendered properly in a static macro don't work in a dynamic macro

fields.description:
I want to put a link into a Confluence Cloud page to a Kibana URL. The URL is very long. Confluence either discards the URL when adding a Web Link from the Link button in the editor, or it fails to save the page if I just paste the URL into the page contents.

Sample URL: fields.summary: In Confluence Cloud I can't save large HTTP links

fields.description:
We are the developers of the Archiving Plugin for Confluence.

One of the functionality of our add-on (archiving pages) includes moving pages from one space to another and moving pages within a space. The algorithms we are using have not been changed for more than a year, but users running most recent Confluence version reported the following frequent error at page moves:

{noformat}
arongombas@arongombas-Latitude-E5420:~/New/support/nyu/application-logs$ grep -A 10 "ObjectNotFoundException" atlassian-confluence.log 
java.lang.RuntimeException: net.sf.hibernate.ObjectNotFoundException: No row with the given identifier exists: [this instance does not yet exist as a row in the database#382795802]
at com.google.common.base.Throwables.propagate(Throwables.java:160)
at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.DefaultPageManager.verifyPageHierarchy(DefaultPageManager.java:1058)
at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.DefaultPageManager.doMovePageAsChild(DefaultPageManager.java:1005)
at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.DefaultPageManager.lambda$null$15(DefaultPageManager.java:999)
at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.DefaultPageManager.executeUnderLocks(DefaultPageManager.java:1912)
at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.DefaultPageManager.lambda$movePageAsChild$16(DefaultPageManager.java:996)
at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.DefaultPageManager.executeWithLogging(DefaultPageManager.java:1940)
at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.DefaultPageManager.movePageAsChild(DefaultPageManager.java:1001)
at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor1715.invoke(Unknown Source)
at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
{noformat}

It seems that newer Confluence version refresh the page-to-move and its new parent in the {{verifyPageHierarchy()}} method, which throws an exception if some error was found. 

My guess is that this is related to corrupt data in the CONFANCESTORS table, referencing an ancestor or descendant that does not appear in the CONTENT table, but I cannot confirm it.

What does this mean exactly? What should we suggest our users to fix it?
fields.summary: "net.sf.hibernate.ObjectNotFoundException: No row with the given identifier exists" when moving pages

fields.description:
This is an issue found by one of our customers currently trialling our product.

# Set up application link to a JIRA instance via OAuth (i.e. it _isn't_ the JIRA instance on the same instance as Confluence which would be marked as "System". The instance added should be marked as "Connected" inside Application Links)
# Already authenticated and granted access to that JIRA instance (e.g. by using the JIRA macro on some Confluence page)
# Create a new page containing a rich-text dynamic macro with another rich-text dynamic macro inside that.
# Place a JIRA macro inside the nested macros that shows issues from the linked JIRA instance accesses a linked JIRA instance via OAuth 
# Save and load the page

*NOTES:*
- Clicking refresh at the bottom of the table inside the JIRA macro succeeds in updating the table. Behind the scenes it appears the initial load vs. the refresh button call a different endpoint.
- This works as expected if the JIRA macro is placed within a single dynamic macro. It only breaks when placed within nested dynamic macros.
fields.summary: JIRA macro asks to authenticate when placed within nested dynamic macros

fields.description:
This is something we are experiencing when creating a dynamic macro in a confluence page.  Curious if this is something that affects third party connect add-ons in general.

- create a dynamic macro for a third party connect add and save it using AP.confluence.saveMacro()
- edit and save the macro again.
- an additional macro is created.  Expected result is that a single macro is updated.

This only happens if the macro is on a draft page.  Once the page is published it is no longer an issue.
fields.summary: Successive saves on a new dynamic macro creates multiple macros

fields.description:
# create a new link ( in an add-on iframe )
# bind an event to this link which uses the navigator api
# use the navigator api to view content by id

* When clicking on this link the page is navigated to the correct place.
* When command (or shift or control) clicking on this link, the current page is navigated and the link is not opened in a new tab.
fields.summary: Navigator go method wont load in new browser tab

fields.description:
When attempting to download a Confluence webresource artifact using a JWT authentication header a HTTP 403 is returned: Example URL: https://jens-k15t.atlassian.net/wiki/jens-k15t.atlassian.net/wiki/s/b67baac2751d7daa1dcdd3eb6865860b-CDN/en_GB/6442/0ee661fea1dd4bb1335a56e97ac2d308f9c51ccf/aa3eebb96737d480c71286fc76bb39cf/_/download/contextbatch/css/_super/batch.css?atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&data-wrm-batch-type=context&data-wrm-key=_super&jquery.external=true&relative-url=true Response: {code:title=HTTP 403 Forbidden} Apache Tomcat/7.0.68 - Error report

fields.summary: Macro with AUI not loading in editor page preview

fields.description:
Content within a Section Macro or Column Macro which is then nested within a Center Macro is not center aligned. Layouts which used to function correctly no longer align center. This only occurs when content is nested. The expectation is that the content can be centered within the containing column/section.

Reference:
https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-238101
fields.summary: The "Center" macro exhibiting unintended behavior

fields.description:
When using the CQLSearchService the response returned is inconsistently escaped. If using the highlight strategy, the body content is escaped and the title is not.

In addition, the actual characters escaped is inconsistent, For example, & lt; should be escaped to & amp;lt; but isn't, while < is correctly escaped to & lt;. 

This seems like it would result in an XSS issue, but it appears to be ok in Confluence search.
fields.summary: Inconsistent escaping in the Confluence Search
Fix broken links in custom content documentation

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce*
# Create a page with a macro on Confluence 5.7 or earlier (before the introduction of macro ID's)
# Upgrade to use atlassian-connect-plugin 1.1.32

*Actual Results*
The values of the {{macro.hash}} and {{macro.id}} context parameters are both empty.

*Workaround*
Edit and save the page. This will cause a macro ID to be generated.
fields.summary: Use macroHash when no macroId is available

fields.description:
Blueprint templates are loaded as the plugin is installed and remain constant until the plugin is upgraded.

Allow for the change where the template content is collected every time a page is created with this blueprint, allowing your add on to dynamically generate a template.
fields.summary: Allow dynamic blueprint templates

fields.description:
/rest/api/contentbody/convert/export_view losing context when converting from storage representation. Everything works fine when using /rest/api/contentbody/convert/view Example: *REQUEST BODY:* {noformat} {content: {id: "18986705"}, representation: "storage", value: "

Atlassian JIRAkey,summary,type,created,updated,due,assignee,reporter,priority,status,resolution144880e9-a353-312f-9412-ed028e8166faCONF-43178

" } {noformat} \\ *1. HTML in the response for the endpoint /rest/api/contentbody/convert/export_view* {noformat} CONF-43178 - ( ) {noformat} \\ *2. HTML in the response for /rest/api/contentbody/convert/view* {noformat} CONF-43178 - Confluence behind multiple reverse proxies Needs Verification {noformat} \\ As you can see the correct icons url are returned in #2, while in #1 they are replaced with $statusIcon and $iconUrl. Also, the description is missing in #1.
fields.summary: /rest/api/contentbody/convert/export_view losing context when converting from storage representation

fields.description:
If I have macro with size 800px x 600px and internal content size of 400px x 300px then in tables/on pages width is respected, however height is not - it makes tables stretch and there is blank space left on pages.


I looked into chrome inspector, and it's because in ap-container width is set as 100%(works great), but height is set to concrete values in pixels, if it set to 100%(as width is) then issue disappear.
fields.summary: Dynamic macro container ignores height of content

fields.description:
Resaving content with the same content but where the embedded version had changed did not cause a new version to be created.

It does now

We've got customers complaining that they aren't seeing our edit source button anymore. It looks like some sort of styling change caused button images to no longer appear on Atlassian connect buttons:

https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.mohamicorp.html.source.editor.for.confluence/cloud/overview

fields.description:
We have a customer reported issue where they are trying to use the JIRA Issue/Filter macro inside of a Table Plus macro (macro in a macro).  This seems to be a common use case for us. The result is the filter macro headers render but the contents of the JIRA filter/query do not. It appears the filter macro is attempting to load resources relative to our iframe.  The error is shown below that we see in the console.  

Here is the error that is displayed in the console: 
jquery.min.js:2 POST https://develop-advanced-tables.bobswift-addons.com/getmacro/undefined/rest/webResources/1.0/resourc... 404 ()
fields.summary: JIRA Issue/Filter macro inside connect macro does not render issue list

The arrow of Inline Dialog (under Web Item) is not aligned.

Please refer to the attached screenshot.

fields.description:
h6. Steps to reproduce:
# Edit this page: https://gliffy.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/gfyqa/pages/40894677/Tests+and+Automated+Tests

JavaScript Console errors:

[Error] Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 504 (HTTP/2.0 504) (40894677.json, line 0)

fields.summary: Page Editor does not load for a page with 220 JIRA queries.

fields.description: Found some errors with the span macro when testing.
fields.summary: Investigate Span macro issues

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*
* create a group called "foo".
* create a space called "bar".
* give the group "foo" space permissions to view all pages.
* delete the group "foo" without removing it from space permissions.
* call the rest api "/rest/api/space/bar?expand=permissions" with a "GET" request

*What happens*
In the permissions array you will still find the group "foo".

What should happen
In permissions array, group "foo" shouldn't exist anymore.
fields.summary: deleted groups and users still get returned in the response of GET /rest/api/space/${spaceKey} requests

fields.description:
Seeing 404 error in macro preview mode. Wrong macro-id is fetched in the preview mode.
https://bobswift13.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/content/14680586/history/1/macro/id/40850e0d-37cc-43d0-8632-191c2bf2c512?_=1487856741741 
https://bobswift13.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/content/14680586/history/1/macro/id/ea59fa28add5228eefd1fcefb60e7033?_=1487856855290 (peview mode)

This issue is common across all our instances (bobswift12, bobswift13, bobswift16,..).  All these instances have version 5.0.0-beta.36

This issue is there even with latest macro preview code changes as suggested in https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/wiki/pages/viewpage.action?spaceKey=CONF&title=Code+change+required+on+macro+side+for+fixing+macro+preview
fields.summary: 404 error while fetching macro content in macro preview mode

fields.description: I am working on a Confluence Connect addon and have some webhooks already working, but when I try to add one for the attachment_removed event, the webhook is not getting triggered. I am pretty sure I have things configured correctly, as if I simply change the "event" in my atlassian-connect.json from "attachment_removed" to "attachment_created" and leave everything else the same, the webhook is triggered. The following is a screenshot of the relevant portion of my atlassian-connect.json. Thank you.
fields.summary: attachment_removed webhook is not sent
